title: Handle type errors in fn args caused by type parameter divergence

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
[Given](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=af5fba0e96614644f655970036f29635)

```rust
fn foo<T>(a: T, b: T) {}

fn main() {
    foo(42, "");
}
```

we currently emit

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:13
  |
4 |     foo(42, "");
  |             ^^ expected integer, found `&str`
```

It should be closer to

```
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:4:13
  |
4 |     foo(42, "");
  |         --  ^^ expected integer, found `&str`
  |         |
  |         expected because this is an integer
  |
note: all arguments that reference the same type parameter must be of the same type
  |
1 | fn foo<T>(a: T, b: T) {}
  |        -  -     - this argument was found to be `&str`
  |        |  |
  |        |  this argument was found to be an integer
  |        this type parameter was found to be an integer and `&str`
```
